level.heading: Bicyclists' use of leading pedestrian intervals.

level.text: A bicyclist may cross at an intersection while following the pedestrian traffic control signal for the bicyclist's direction of travel unless otherwise directed by traffic signs or traffic control devices.
A bicyclist may cross an intersection where a leading pedestrian interval is used.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 20-49 added this section.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 20-49
level.text: Law 20-49, the "Bicycle Safety Amendment Act of 2013," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-140. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 10, 2013, and October 1, 2013, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 17, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 20-188 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-49 became effective on December 13, 2013.
